intro: Allomaieta villosa, commonly known as the hairy allomaieta, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its hairy, glandular leaves and yellow-orange flowers that bloom in the summer. It thrives in dry, open habitats and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside of botanical circles.
